reference.shortdesc: The remedy element contains steps that are a potential solution for the problem.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: The remedy element is a component of potential solution. The remedy might be omitted if there is no known remedy for the cause.

section.title: Specialization hierarchy
section.p: The remedy element is specialized from section. It is defined in the troubleshooting module.

example.title: Example
example.p: In the following code sample, the remedy element contains instructions for how the responsible party can fix the problem. Note that rather than cross-referencing to another topic, the steps element from an existing topic is reused.
example.codeblock: <troubleSolution> <cause>A recurring memory fault indicates a possible problem with the system memory board. Reseating the board might fix the problem. </cause> <remedy> <steps conref="reseatBoard.dita#reseatBoard/steps"> <step><cmd/></step> </steps> </remedy> </troubleSolution>
